name: places/ChIJrzWdmaFZwokRw3PW3r39K-8
formattedAddress: 540 E 5th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 540 E 5th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text: Was enticed by their happy hour deal ($15 for burger and beer) so decided to give it a visit. The burgers are quite delicious (meat perfectly cooked and flavorful, but the buns were just meh). Gave it 3 stars because we didn't like that we were asked if we wanted fries or onion rings like it is part of the happy hour deal, but it was extra. Mind you - the happy hour deal was only on the board outside of the restaurant, but there was no mention of it on the menu. When we asked what was included at the happy hour, the waiter said 'its what that's on the board'. At that point, unless you walk out of the restaurant and check, you wouldn't have known. (and based on another review it seems like a habit to sneakily add items on the bills for things that seemed free). At the end it is still a good deal, but we felt deceived and it left a bad taste. Had it not been the case we would be coming back.

originalText.text: Low key spot in east village serving one of the best burgers in the city. The burgers are cooked fresh, straight from the grill to your table. Juicy patties, buttered buns, absolute perfection. The fries were so good too. Glad my cousin asked to come here. Definitely a great find in the neighborhood

text.text: Low key spot in east village serving one of the best burgers in the city. The burgers are cooked fresh, straight from the grill to your table. Juicy patties, buttered buns, absolute perfection. The fries were so good too. Glad my cousin asked to come here. Definitely a great find in the neighborhood

originalText.text: I got the original burger and it was delicious l. The quality of the burgers was great. I also got onion rings and they were decent. The atmosphere, service, and drinks were wonderful. My only complaint was the food was overpriced in my opinion. I would recommend this place though

text.text: I got the original burger and it was delicious l. The quality of the burgers was great. I also got onion rings and they were decent. The atmosphere, service, and drinks were wonderful. My only complaint was the food was overpriced in my opinion. I would recommend this place though

originalText.text: cozy neighborhood burger shop with beer and wine options planted in Alphabet City. casual spot with charm of its own--seating at the bar and several tables. stopped in to pick up a L'Bacon burger but ended up eating at the bar--the burger was ample sized with a thick patty, strips of bacon, melted cheddar, lettuce, tomatoes, onions and more all sandwiches in a soft bun. if burgers are your thing, this spot has a a number of signature hamburgers to sate your carnivorous ways. the service is friendly and has personality. at times, the spirit of NYC seems to be disappearing amidst everything becoming "the same," THANKFULLY places like Le Burger are keeping it alive and thriving by providing an experience, not just calories for money

originalText.text: Great burger spot in the neighborhood with a nice burger special (burger&beer). Thank you to Roman and Tony for a good time! Burger and beer for less than 20 bucks, you can't beat it!
